intro: Peltaria perennis, commonly known as the perennial peltaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded areas. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Peltaria perennis is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
